title: Argenttenir
author: Argenttenir
content: Hello I can pick up some Avalon A851 's for 50$ a piece is that an ok deal? I realize I have to get  a pi ,auc3 converter and some cables , my main question was on the software I saw there is avalon 8 out there I am just wondering how low you can turn down the frequency on these to run them on low power or with just one board instead of all boards. If so how low can you turn them down? does the software even allow it? What is the best software to use? If you have 2 miners on 1 pi can you set each one on a different pool? Is there software where you could you plug the auc 3 straight into a motherboard and skip using the pi and converter ? In  your opinion would it be better to just stick with the s9s . I have heard these were solid but there is such little info about them.  I would be using these to solo mine sha256 coins currently am running 2 s9s 3.5th @ 270 w.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: The old Avalons are very friendly to tweaking. For a start, refer to HaggsFIN setup/repair guide for them located here. Somewhere around there should also be the testing parameters I played around with for the 841's. The commands for all of the Avalon 8xx are the same. I'll try to find those posts for links.As for running on just 1 side, just connect the power to the 1 side of the miner and it will be happy.The controller sets the pool you use and all miners connected to a controller will use that pool. The controller cannot run miners on different pools at the same time.Technically, yes you *can* download and compile Canaans software to run on a PC BUT it is a royal PITA to do so. Far far easier to use Canaan's pre-built software loaded onto a Raspi 3B (not B+ which does not work).

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: The $50 is still a pretty good deal for this unit not profitable if you don't have a free power source but since your purpose is to solo mine then I think you can remove the other hashboard to reduce power and you can play with the ssh command or through API.If you are looking for commands for this unit you can find it here below - https://github.com/Canaan-Creative/avalon8-docs/wiki/AvalonMiner-8-developmentAbout running the miner without tools I can't seem to find someone successful running it without raspi and au3.Check the guide here if you need a guide https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5044027.0

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: QuoteI have tried logging in through a laptop direct with no help does it need to be a crossover or can it be a straight through cat5? For a direct PC-miner connection you need a crossover cable. If you connect through a switch or router then cable does not matter as the switch will handle which lines are for Tx and which are Rx.

comments.author: Skot
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on October 24, 2022, 01:12:34 AMQuoteI have tried logging in through a laptop direct with no help does it need to be a crossover or can it be a straight through cat5? For a direct PC-miner connection you need a crossover cable. If you connect through a switch or router then cable does not matter as the switch will handle which lines are for Tx and which are Rx.The Raspberry pi or any somewhat recent laptop will auto sense the ethernet RX and TX lines, so it does not matter if you use a crossover cable or not (Auto-MDIX). The problem with a direct connection is more likely; who is assigning IP addresses? Look for some "internet sharing" type option on your laptop.
